origin: You regularly make new friends.
interrogative: Do you regularly make new friends?
chinese: 你经常交新朋友吗？

origin: You spend a lot of your free time exploring various random topics that pique your interest.
interrogative: Do you spend a lot of your free time exploring various random topics that pique your interest?
chinese: 你是否在空闲时间里花很多时间探索吸引你的各种随机话题？

origin: Seeing other people cry can easily make you feel like you want to cry too.
interrogative: Does seeing other people cry easily make you feel like you want to cry too?
chinese: 看到别人哭很容易让你也想哭吗？

origin: You often make a backup plan for a backup plan.
interrogative: Do you often make a backup plan for a backup plan?
chinese: 你经常为备份计划制定备份计划吗？

origin: You usually stay calm, even under a lot of pressure.
interrogative: Do you usually stay calm, even under a lot of pressure?
chinese: 即使在很大的压力下，你通常还是很冷静吗？

origin: At social events, you rarely try to introduce yourself to new people and mostly talk to the ones you already know.
interrogative: At social events, do you rarely try to introduce yourself to new people and mostly talk to the ones you already know?
chinese: 在社交活动中，你是不是很少向新认识的人介绍自己，而主要和你已经认识的人交谈？

origin: You prefer to completely finish one project before starting another.
interrogative: Do you prefer to completely finish one project before starting another?
chinese: 你更喜欢先完全完成一个项目再开始另一个项目吗？

origin: You are very sentimental.
interrogative: Would you describe yourself as very sentimental?
chinese: 你会形容自己是非常多愁善感的人吗？

origin: You like to use organizing tools like schedules and lists.
interrogative: Do you like to use organizing tools like schedules and lists?
chinese: 你喜欢使用诸如日程表和清单之类的组织工具吗？

origin: Even a small mistake can cause you to doubt your overall abilities and knowledge.
interrogative: Does even a small mistake cause you to doubt your overall abilities and knowledge?
chinese: 即使是一个小错误也会让你怀疑自己的总体能力和知识吗？

origin: You feel comfortable just walking up to someone you find interesting and striking up a conversation.
interrogative: Do you feel comfortable just walking up to someone you find interesting and striking up a conversation?
chinese: 你是否觉得只需要和你认为有趣的人交谈就会让你感到很自在？

origin: You are not too interested in discussing various interpretations and analyses of creative works.
interrogative: Are you not particularly keen on discussing various interpretations and analyses of creative works?
chinese: 你对讨论创意作品的各种解读和分析不太感兴趣吗？

origin: You are more inclined to follow your head than your heart.
interrogative: Do you tend to follow your head more than your heart?
chinese: 你更倾向于用头脑思考而不是跟随内心的感觉吗？

origin: You usually prefer just doing what you feel like at any given moment instead of planning a particular daily routine.
interrogative: Do you often do what you feel like at any moment rather than sticking to a particular daily routine?
chinese: 你是不是通常喜欢随心所欲地做事，而不是坚持某种特定的日常流程？

origin: You rarely worry about whether you make a good impression on people you meet.
interrogative: Do you rarely worry about the impression you leave on people you meet?
chinese: 你是否很少担心你给认识的人留下的印象？

origin: You enjoy participating in group activities.
interrogative: Do you enjoy taking part in group activities?
chinese: 你喜欢参加团队活动吗？

origin: You like books and movies that make you come up with your own interpretation of the ending.
interrogative: Do you appreciate books and movies that allow you to form your own interpretation of the ending?
chinese: 你喜欢那些让你自己解读结局的书籍和电影吗？

origin: Your happiness comes more from helping others accomplish things than your own accomplishments.
interrogative: Do you find more happiness in helping others achieve things compared to your own accomplishments?
chinese: 帮助他人取得成就比自己的成就更能带给你快乐吗？

origin: You are interested in so many things that you find it difficult to choose what to try next.
interrogative: Are you so intrigued by various things that you often struggle with what to pursue next?
chinese: 你对很多事情都很感兴趣，以至于很难选择下一步要尝试什么吗？

origin: You are prone to worrying that things will take a turn for the worse.
interrogative: Do you often worry that situations might worsen?
chinese: 你经常担心情况会变得更糟吗？

origin: You avoid leadership roles in group settings.
interrogative: Do you tend to avoid taking on leadership roles in group situations?
chinese: 你是否倾向于避免在团队中担任领导角色？

origin: You are definitely not an artistic type of person.
interrogative: Would you say you're not really the artistic type?
chinese: 你会说你真的不是艺术型的人吗？

origin: You think the world would be a better place if people relied more on rationality and less on their feelings.
interrogative: Do you believe the world would be better if people were more rational and less emotional?
chinese: 你认为如果人们更理智、少一些情感化，这个世界会更好吗？

origin: You prefer to do your chores before allowing yourself to relax.
interrogative: Do you usually finish your chores before giving yourself time to relax?
chinese: 你通常会在让自己放松之前先完成家务吗？

origin: You enjoy watching people argue.
interrogative: Do you find it enjoyable to watch people argue?
chinese: 你喜欢看人们争论吗？

origin: You tend to avoid drawing attention to yourself.
interrogative: Do you usually avoid drawing attention to yourself?
chinese: 你通常避免引起对自己的关注吗？

origin: Your mood can change very quickly.
interrogative: Does your mood tend to fluctuate rapidly?
chinese: 你的心情是否往往变化得很快？

origin: You lose patience with people who are not as efficient as you.
interrogative: Do you get impatient with people who aren't as efficient as you?
chinese: 你对那些不如你效率高的人会不耐烦吗？

origin: You often end up doing things at the last possible moment.
interrogative: Do you frequently find yourself doing tasks at the very last moment?
chinese: 你经常在最后一刻完成任务吗？

origin: You have always been fascinated by the question of what, if anything, happens after death.
interrogative: Have you always been intrigued by the question of what might happen after death?
chinese: 你一直对死后可能会发生什么事情感到好奇吗？

origin: You usually prefer to be around others rather than on your own.
interrogative: Do you generally enjoy being around others more than being by yourself?
chinese: 你通常更喜欢与他人在一起，而不是独自一人吗？

origin: You become bored or lose interest when the discussion gets highly theoretical.
interrogative: Do you tend to lose interest when discussions become very theoretical?
chinese: 当讨论变得非常理论化时，你会失去兴趣吗？

origin: You find it easy to empathize with a person whose experiences are very different from yours.
interrogative: Is it easy for you to empathize with someone who has had experiences quite different from yours?
chinese: 对于经历与你大不相同的人，你容易产生共鸣吗？

origin: You usually postpone finalizing decisions for as long as possible.
interrogative: Do you often delay making final decisions as long as you can?
chinese: 你通常会尽可能地延迟做最终决定吗？

origin: You rarely second-guess the choices that you have made.
interrogative: Do you seldom question or doubt the choices you've made?
chinese: 你很少质疑或怀疑你所做的选择吗？

origin: After a long and exhausting week, a lively social event is just what you need.
interrogative: After an exhausting week, do you find that a lively social event rejuvenates you?
chinese: 经过一个疲惫的星期后，一个热闹的社交活动能让你恢复活力吗？

origin: You enjoy going to art museums.
interrogative: Do you like visiting art museums?
chinese: 你喜欢参观艺术博物馆吗？

origin: You often have a hard time understanding other people’s feelings.
interrogative: Do you frequently find it challenging to understand other people's emotions?
chinese: 你经常觉得很难理解他人的情感吗？

origin: You like to have a to-do list for each day.
interrogative: Do you prefer having a to-do list prepared for each day?
chinese: 你喜欢为每一天准备一个待办事项清单吗？

origin: You rarely feel insecure.
interrogative: Do you seldom feel insecure?
chinese: 你很少感到不安全吗？

origin: You avoid making phone calls.
interrogative: Do you tend to avoid making phone calls?
chinese: 你倾向于避免打电话吗？

origin: You often spend a lot of time trying to understand views that are very different from your own.
interrogative: Do you frequently invest time in trying to understand perspectives very different from yours?
chinese: 你经常花很多时间尝试理解与自己截然不同的观点吗？

origin: In your social circle, you are often the one who contacts your friends and initiates activities.
interrogative: In your group of friends, are you usually the one reaching out and suggesting activities?
chinese: 在你的社交圈中，你经常是联系朋友并发起活动的那个人吗？

origin: If your plans are interrupted, your top priority is to get back on track as soon as possible.
interrogative: If something disrupts your plans, do you prioritize getting back on track immediately?
chinese: 如果你的计划被打断，你的首要任务是尽快回到正轨吗？

origin: You are still bothered by mistakes that you made a long time ago.
interrogative: Are you still troubled by mistakes you committed a long time back?
chinese: 你是否仍然为很久以前犯的错误而困扰？

origin: You rarely contemplate the reasons for human existence or the meaning of life.
interrogative: Do you seldom ponder about the reasons for human existence or life's purpose?
chinese: 你很少思考人类存在的原因或生活的意义吗？

origin: Your emotions control you more than you control them.
interrogative: Do you feel that your emotions often have more control over you than you have over them?
chinese: 你觉得你的情感经常控制你，超过你控制它们吗？

origin: You take great care not to make people look bad, even when it is completely their fault.
interrogative: Do you go out of your way to avoid making others look bad, even if they're clearly at fault?
chinese: 即使完全是他们的错，你也会小心翼翼地不让人看起来很糟糕吗？

origin: Your personal work style is closer to spontaneous bursts of energy than organized and consistent efforts.
interrogative: Would you say your work style leans more towards spontaneous bursts of energy rather than steady and organized efforts?
chinese: 你会说你的工作风格更偏向于能量的自发爆发，而不是有组织和持续的努力吗？

origin: When someone thinks highly of you, you wonder how long it will take them to feel disappointed in you.
interrogative: When someone holds you in high regard, do you often wonder how long before they get disappointed in you?
chinese: 当有人高度评价你时，你是否经常想知道他们对你失望要多久？

origin: You would love a job that requires you to work alone most of the time.
interrogative: Would you prefer a job that entails working solo for the majority of the time?
chinese: 你会喜欢一个大部分时间都需要你独自工作的工作吗？

origin: You believe that pondering abstract philosophical questions is a waste of time.
interrogative: Do you think that dwelling on abstract philosophical topics is just a waste of time?
chinese: 你认为深入探讨抽象的哲学问题是浪费时间吗？

origin: You feel more drawn to places with busy, bustling atmospheres than quiet, intimate places.
interrogative: Are you more attracted to lively, bustling environments than to quiet and intimate settings?
chinese: 与安静、亲密的地方相比，你更喜欢繁忙、喧闹的环境吗？

origin: You know at first glance how someone is feeling.
interrogative: Can you often tell how someone is feeling just by a quick glance?
chinese: 你经常可以一眼就看出某人的感受吗？

origin: You often feel overwhelmed.
interrogative: Do you frequently feel overwhelmed by situations or emotions?
chinese: 你经常感到不知所措或情感上的压力吗？

origin: You complete things methodically without skipping over any steps.
interrogative: Do you approach tasks in a methodical manner, ensuring you don't miss any steps?
chinese: 你是否以有条不紊的方式完成任务，确保不漏掉任何步骤？

origin: You are very intrigued by things labeled as controversial.
interrogative: Are you highly captivated by subjects or matters that are deemed controversial?
chinese: 你是否对被视为有争议的主题或事务非常感兴趣？

origin: You would pass along a good opportunity if you thought someone else needed it more.
interrogative: Would you give up a favorable opportunity if you believed someone else required it more?
chinese: 如果你认为其他人更需要，你会放弃一个好的机会吗？

origin: You struggle with deadlines.
interrogative: Do you often find it challenging to meet deadlines?
chinese: 你是否经常发现很难在截止日期之前完成任务？

origin: You feel confident that things will work out for you.
interrogative: Are you confident that, in the end, things will turn out well for you?
chinese: 你是否对事情最终会对你有利感到自信？
